If the combined effect of the single drug doses is consistent with Eq. ( 6), this drug combination is evaluated as additive according to the Bliss independence measure. For instance, suppose that drugs A and B exhibit 50% and 60% inhibition, respectively. The Bliss independence predicts that drugs A and B will exert a combined inhibitory effect of 80%, calculated as P
AB = 0.5 + 0.6 - 0.5 × 0.6 = 0.8.
